summary: Build a responsive React project version of an interactive Valentine-themed webpage (multi-page flow with animations, audio, and images).
architectural_notes: Implement as a responsive React single-page app with component-based pages and state-driven navigation.
Support user-configurable media assets (e.g., GIF) via a configurable asset path or upload/selection, and reference it from React state/config rather than hardcoding.
known_issues: Previous deployment/draft expired; site needs rebuild/redeploy to provide a working shareable link.

existing_features.title: Recreate the provided Valentine HTML/CSS/JS experience as a responsive React + TypeScript UI with Tailwind styling, preserving the same multi-screen flow: (1) “Will You Be My Valentine?” screen with Yes/No actions, (2) “Choose your Gift” screen, (3) Gift 1 question screen with four choices, (4) Gift 2 message screen, (5) Gift 3 message + two images screen, and (6) final success screen.

Implement the falling-hearts animation as a React-friendly effect (no direct DOM scripting outside React lifecycle), matching the original behavior: hearts spawn periodically at random horizontal positions, fall down the viewport with varying durations, and get cleaned up after they finish.

Add background music playback using a bundled static audio asset, with safe browser behavior: provide a visible play/pause control and attempt autoplay only where allowed. The music should loop when playing.

Create a cohesive Valentine-themed visual design using Tailwind: warm pink/rose palette, soft gradients, rounded buttons, and a playful typography pairing (including a safe fallback if Poppins is unavailable). Apply the theme consistently across all screens.

Add a simple asset pipeline for the referenced media (GIF + photos + audio): place assets under a frontend public assets folder and update the React UI to reference those paths. Provide sensible placeholders if user photos are not available.
Add a user-facing way to replace the default couple GIF on the “Will You Be My Valentine?” screen with a user-chosen GIF, without requiring code changes.

Add a new first screen (Welcome) before the existing “Will You Be My Valentine?” screen, matching the user’s original HTML flow: show a welcome title/message, display a “Rose GIF” image, and provide a single “Continue” button that navigates to the existing Valentine question screen.

Use the user-provided Tenor GIF URLs in the React app: set the default GIF on the “Will You Be My Valentine?” screen to https://media.tenor.com/wGUEcMJvn1gAAAAd/bubu-dudu-hug.gif, and add/display the Gift 2 Kiss GIF (https://media.tenor.com/tz2d6kItD0gAAAAd/bubu-dudu-kisses.gif) on the Gift 2 message screen similarly to the original HTML.
Update the ValentineFlow navigation model to include the new Welcome screen while preserving all existing screens, animations (falling hearts), and background music behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert the provided Valentine HTML/CSS/JS page into a responsive React project (components, navigation between pages, falling hearts animation, audio, and assets).
Allow replacing the default bear-couple GIF with a user-chosen GIF (provide a configurable asset path or upload/selection mechanism and update UI to use it).
Add the requested Bubu Dudu Rose GIF to the first (welcome) page in addition to the existing Hug (Page 2) and Kiss (Page 5) GIFs.
Rebuild and redeploy the Valentine website to provide a clean, shareable public URL (shared-link website).

projectName: Convert Valentine HTML page into a responsive React app
